s.text: It's true: AIDS is nature's awful retribution for our tolerance of immoderate and socially irresponsible sexual behavior.
First, we don't know that Maxwell would have found another partner: Without Joan, he might have struck out that night.
Second, reducing the rate of HIV transmission is in any event not the only social goal worth pursuing: If it were, we'd outlaw sex entirely.
Second, reducing the rate of HIV transmission is in any event not the only social goal worth pursuing: If it were, we'd outlaw sex entirely.
Second, reducing the rate of HIV transmission is in any event not the only social goal worth pursuing: If it were, we'd outlaw sex entirely.
Second, reducing the rate of HIV transmission is in any event not the only social goal worth pursuing: If it were, we'd outlaw sex entirely.
That gives you a 50-50 chance of finding a relatively safe match.
That gives you a 50-50 chance of finding a relatively safe match.
In Martin's absence, Joan hooked up with the equally charming but considerably less prudent Maxwell--and Joan got AIDS.
